website_summaries.verdict: Expensive grappling dummy, but it can handle a lot of rough training sessions.
pros: Life-size grappling dummy that's perfect for adults who want to practice MMA, wrestling, and jujitsu
Consists of vinyl exterior that will last a long time, even when subjected to powerful strikes
Ships filled, so you can begin using it immediately
cons: Ships filled, so you'll pay a little extra in shipping costs

customer_reviews.title: Dead weight and dead head for getting this thing!
customer_reviews.text: If you purchase this thing, please get the 90lb weighted dummy. I made a mistake of taking the 140 lb since I am a big guy. 140 lbs of deadweight.. kind of reminds me of my mother-in-law minus the mouth!
customer_reviews.author: TWest

customer_reviews.title: 90 lb is great!
customer_reviews.text: We got the 90 for our son. He’s been practicing judo and karate on it. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Steeler

customer_reviews.title: Martial Arts All Purpose Practice Dummy
customer_reviews.text: I do everything martial arts with this wrestling dummy. For I stand him up against a wall in which I land punches, kicks, elbows, and knees against his body. I also slam him to the ground for wrestling purposes. And I roll around with him on the ground for grappling purposes. So this dude is good for basically practicing all or most styles of martial arts. And I almost forgot I manipulate his wrists & arms for Aikido or Aikido type of moves. But I must say his body does get some what pushed in from all the strikes, but yet he's always still able to take more physical abuse, and seems to bounce back to form.
customer_reviews.author: komarco

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME when solo training.
customer_reviews.text: Stick to the 90lbs bag. If you want power development do Squats, Deadlift, and other powerlifts. For purpose of Judo/Jujitsu throws, reaps, and sweeps, this is PERFECT. Comes FILLED so if you want to be able to move this thing for general purposes, 90lbs is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: HuyÂ QuocÂ Dang

customer_reviews.title: 90 lb of Dead Weight
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty good, but 90 lb of dead weight is a lot more than you think it is. The materials on it seem ok as well. I will see as I get a chance to use it more.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Lee Ashby

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable Bag of Garbage in the Shape of a Human
customer_reviews.text: If modified, can work alright. I'm glad to have this; for the price it is worth it. Durable cover but filled with funky fabric scraps, some garbage (including glass and Betelnut wrappers), and rubber scraps (probably to control weight). I gave it open chest surgery and removed the rubber, and the bamboo leg bones. After adding some old bed sheets, it is a nice weight and softer to get your body around. Seams and fabric are durable enough to outlast my homemade dummy, which I tore the arms off in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu drills
customer_reviews.text: You can train doing throws, side mount escapes, triangles and armbars and drill position transitions (mount to knee-on-belly, left to right, mount to S-mount, etc.). Take the lightest one (70lb) as they are really heavy to lift and will exhaust you quickly preventing you from doing more reps of drilling which is the main point of a dummy
customer_reviews.author: MUHAMMAD SAMIR

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. I weigh 260 and promise you you don’t want any more weight than 90 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D.

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than it sounds.
customer_reviews.text: Great dummy to practice muscle memory and takedowns. Seams look sturdy, will update after some heavy use. Got the 90 pound one and it gets heavier than you would think when practicing takedowns
customer_reviews.author: Charliño

customer_reviews.title: 90 pounds a bit light
customer_reviews.text: I've got the 90 pounds one and overall I am satisfied with it. My weight is 200+ pounds and I think some more weight will be better, but its OK. After a couple of throws the 40 dead-body kilos started being noticed. The only critique is that those arms make it impossible to fit a gi on them , I tried an A4 and it will not fit.
customer_reviews.author: AGV

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Got the 70lbs er. Brought back memories of the Marine Corps wrestling team when we threw dummies every day lol. Took my 13 year old son a while to get used to it, but now he can handle the dead weight of the dummy. Actually made him noticeably strong learning to handle the dummy. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: James Acquaviva

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Note to self: Much harder to do than it was 50 yrs ago. Only gripe is that the arms should be more anatomically correct.. wider apart, and attached at the shoulders, rather than the chest. Very difficult for many judo throws.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R. Garskof

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My wrestling 11 yr old son and husband love this. 90 lb dead weight is heavy so be prepared lol highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Busted - twice
customer_reviews.text: I got this dummy to continue practicing my jujitsu throws. Unfortunately, the stitching around the waste has came undone twice already. Additionally, I found metal shards inside the dummy, among the rags used as stuffing. I probably go about 20 hrs worth of training, and it is now useless. Save your self the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Garrido

customer_reviews.title: Love the dummy, but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Loved the item itself, but within 5 weeks of very light use the seam at the wrist split open and stuffing was coming out. Very disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: An excellent training tool! Should have gotten one before. Super fast shipping from this vendor!
customer_reviews.author: Gene P

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I own a "regular" heavy bag, a UFC grappling bag, and a few other things. i have trained combat/Martial arts for years. This seems to be a good quality piece. no issues as of yet. Honestly if at some part is does start to come apart if i know i have been slamming it and what not then i'll patch it up. I mean that's what it for right? I would recommend though. I have the 90lb one and it's a nice amount of dead weight.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Does not stand freely :(
customer_reviews.text: Heavy for sure but to awkward for what my son is looking for. Does not stand without someone or something holding it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sand leaks
customer_reviews.text: The sand inside stranded coming out from day 1 of doing throws. It's fine if you just want to work ground and pound, but if lat drop, suplex, or anything else that makes the dummy impact the ground your mats will end up sandy.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Law

customer_reviews.title: This product is a good start. The weight is about right for movement-grappling ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is a good start. The weight is about right for movement-grappling and for helping students develop simple techniques. One thing I would have made better is to get the length of the arms to be a bit longer. Other than that, it's a good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its very versatile and tough perfect for quarantine training
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for bjj and ground and pound. But it worked as a heavy bag standing up as well. If you dont have a place to hang a heavy bag this is a good alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Blaze

customer_reviews.title: Put a gi on this guy and practice my throws ...
customer_reviews.text: Put a gi on this guy and practice my throws, heavy enough for a workout but light enough I'm not killing myself picking it back up after each throw.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie4Fngrs

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Durable materials. Great for practicing judo and some Jujitsu skills.
customer_reviews.author: alfredo rivera

customer_reviews.title: Heavy enough
customer_reviews.text: I hAve had no time to test too much but trust me 70lb is enough dead weight I almost did 120-140 whatever and I’m sooo glad I didn’t it’s like 70 is man sized the rest is just superfluous
customer_reviews.author: derek stone

customer_reviews.title: It appears to be rugged and has has been a great tool for practicing my Judo throws
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly as advertised. It appears to be rugged and has has been a great tool for practicing my Judo throws. I have gotten some strange looks as I drive down the road with the dummy in the passenger seat.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun S Bennett

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised seems well made the wrists are a little thicker than expected. Purchased for Physical assessment to help demonstrate the significant difference of "dead" weight in rescue scenarios
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Yeah it's Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: 90lbs was heavy at first now it feels alot lighter. Cause i'm gett'n stronger... LOVE THIS THING!!!
customer_reviews.author: S.V.

customer_reviews.title: Life like, great for takedowns and grappling
customer_reviews.text: Great dummy. My son and I use it to train for takedowns and holds. The only issue I have with it is the arms or just a little short. But still gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal Revis

customer_reviews.title: super work out  buddy!
customer_reviews.text: i like this dummy he never complains of the holds i put on him he never takes a day off hes always ready to be thrown around all over town! great work out aide for mma fighters and practioners! tauz westbury ny
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L. Petty

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Don't forget....70 lbs deadweight is like 140 lbs! High quality dummy!
customer_reviews.author: ELH

customer_reviews.title: Takes alot to be a dummy. Great partner.
customer_reviews.text: Great little training partner. Now I can go full speed and work on my timing and spacing more for my Karate.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Not "heavy duty nylon" .... 70lbs not an easy return.
customer_reviews.text: Description says "Heavy duty nylon", which is what I use at my gym...same brand and weight. However, this product is made of vinyl, pleather, or some other material. However, not heavy duty nylon. No idea how long this one will last and Not a simple return.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Foley

customer_reviews.title: It is great and the guys are having great workouts with it
customer_reviews.text: We named our workout partner, "Gumby". It is great and the guys are having great workouts with it. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Kaybee

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Packed tight and good weight (90lb)
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Packed tight and good weight (90lb). Glad i didnt go heavier. Material seems tough and dourable. There were some reviews about the arm ripping during armbars but remember that this is made for throwing and not ripping on limbs and it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great for hitting, but not ground work. To heavily.
customer_reviews.text: 120 Pounds of dead weight, should have picked a lighter one. The right arm is lose.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great for training
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a friend that needed to practice lifting someone and moving them to safety. Worked out great for training.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great value but it's not good for submissions unless you want to rep arm bars all day long.
customer_reviews.author: John Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty good but it seemed little bit heavy then what it shows on the body
customer_reviews.author: ADAHAMJON

customer_reviews.title: We bought these for our agents to train with and they are quite a workout.
customer_reviews.text: We got the 70 lbs and they are awesome. we got it out of the box and it immediately punched my friend in the face. It was soooo funny.
customer_reviews.author: Mississippi Gaming Commission

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this product while it lasted but it busted wide open and stuffing flew everywhere after about 20 workouts or so. Very disappointing for the money I shelled out (I get around 50 workouts of throwing real partners for the same price). A dummy meant to be slammed over and over again needs to be designed with durability in mind and the lack thereof with this product is unacceptable
customer_reviews.author: Serious Pimp

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for our buck
customer_reviews.text: We were super pleased with the quality of this grappling dummy and the price was the best we found. What a super buy! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Sears

customer_reviews.title: Arm bars
customer_reviews.text: This grappling dummy works out great for my arm bar practicing. I am over 400 lbs and limited when it comes to real people. However the arms could be a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Fred beaugard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for use with our novice high school wrestlers. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Conway

customer_reviews.title: Great products and customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding customer service! Will definitely purchase other equipment from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Gladys O

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, but it feels more like 150lbs instead of 120lbs, so my workouts brutal
customer_reviews.author: Lady H

customer_reviews.title: Bad arm positioning, otherwise good quality
customer_reviews.text: Arm position is too close together, like their shoulders are sprouting from their chest.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Good strong heavy duty training dummy
customer_reviews.text: Good strong heavy duty training dummy. Very durable and can withstand a powerful spin wheel kick with tennis shoes. I use it to practice stand up western boxing and then close in with elbows and knees in the clinch. I finish my workout with the idea that the fight progresses to the ground and initiate a wrestling take down with an arm bar conclusion assuming I'm only figthing one oppenent! Of course, dummies don't fight back, but it serves as a great training tool because you can't simply go around picking street fights in order to practice techniques. You'd eventually get killed! Heck, a little training is better than no training at all.
customer_reviews.author: The Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Delivery was better than anticipated and my grandson was thrilled and uses ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was better than anticipated and my grandson was thrilled and uses it to practice moves and techniques in between classes
customer_reviews.author: Janice Dorris

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift. The birthday boy was very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: was used twice and the arm completely ripped off very poor quality
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: A best friend
customer_reviews.text: Bob and I clicked ever since I opened him up and we’ve been together ever since! He’s like my best friend and I think I might be developing... feelings!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Pio

customer_reviews.title: Good for training
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my wrestling teenagers. They have used it quite a bit to work out with while training.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great work out partner
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the grappling dummy. Great work out partner.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C. Zachry

customer_reviews.title: Great for working out with.
customer_reviews.text: Like most of the other reviews, I too found it hilarious watching it be delivered. In my case, it was unboxed or packaged so it was merely the dummy that was delivered. The funny part was that the hands were bound with rope so I can only imagine what my neighbors must have thought. My only issue was the very sticky shipping label that was affixed to the dummy. Otherwise, it is great for working out with. Its definitely a dead weight so dont let the weight fool you; it's very heavy!!
customer_reviews.author: Flower Power

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product for those that don't have time to hit the dojo.
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: Great for training when you can't make it to the gym
customer_reviews.text: felt bad for the delivery man who had to deliver this, I am almost positive it weighs more than 90 lbs but no complaints, not the best for training chokes or legit arm bars but you can get the flow and movement down, I like to use it when I am sick and can't go train, I pull this out and can work on transitions and pressure over and over, very sturdy and can withstand a lot of abuse!
customer_reviews.author: Herbin' Legend

customer_reviews.title: They are durable and a great training aid
customer_reviews.text: We've been pounding 2 of these dummies 3-5 times a week for about 3 months. They are durable and a great training aid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the sewing is breaking and the middle is not filled not still.
customer_reviews.text: Today I've seen the sewing is breaking in suck way that I can see the filling. I barely worked 4 times with this dummy on sponge mats.
customer_reviews.author: trustciprian

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: My son is really enjoying it thanks! He was very happy when he got up Christmas morning to this huge grappling dummy
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Maher

customer_reviews.title: Wrestler didn't like it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew who is a wrestler. Good product and durable, but difficult for him to get attempt upper body locks and submission holds. Arms are very stiff. Poor packaging as well!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: It's single legged
customer_reviews.text: Product is single legged not double . The advertising picture is incorrect . The product doesn't seem bad but I can't leave anything more than a 1 because I was visually lied too.
customer_reviews.author: EricM

customer_reviews.title: Too huge and heavy for youth or middle school wrestlers
customer_reviews.text: Too huge and heavy for youth or middle school wrestlers..built good, and good quality, but way to big for my 8 year old 80 pounder. got the 90lbs one.
customer_reviews.author: John Zmorowski

customer_reviews.title: Really Heavy and awkward.
customer_reviews.text: Hi, This product came quickly. It was green and has a stench. I am 6 foot 200 lbs and pretty strong. This dummy is very heavy and awkward to menuver. I don't get as much practice as I wish I could have with this dummy. I just bought a smaller one 2 use as a pre requisite to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kuldeep

customer_reviews.title: Very stiff and unnatural - I do not like it at all
customer_reviews.text: Completely unnatural and feels like grappling with a log. Arms are too short, legs and torso don't bend, only has half a head. This is an awful grappling dummy for trying to learn technique with. Two stars instead of one because the build quality is at least decent. Shipping was pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: azca

customer_reviews.title: My kids have gotten a lot of use out of ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids have gotten a lot of use out of it. There only criticism I have is after using it for a couple weeks, the stitching is coming out on the "arm pits" and the "neck."
customer_reviews.author: T.Marshall

product_meta.title: Combat Sports 70, 90, 120 & 140 lb Grappling MMA Wrestling Submission Fitness Jui Jitsu Dummy
product_meta.description: The ultimate training partner Full out training sessions without the risk of injuring your training partner. Perfect your take downs, throws, submissions and strikes. Durable nylon construction.
feature_bullets: This grappling dummy is the ultimate training partner for MMA, wrestling, Jiu Jitsu and submission practice
Use this contact sport dummy and go full out with your training sessions without the risk of injuring your training partner
This life size dummy is perfect for take downs, throws, submissions and strikes. Dummy weighs approximately 120 lbs and stands 5' 10" tall
Made of durable and easy to clean military-grade vinyl construction
Available in a variety of weights for your home or commercial gym needs

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
